page.title: 10GARDEN CENTRE, NR.COAL ASTON
page.content: {Ward's Garden Centre}was started in 1968. They grow mainly heathers. Some of these are sold to other garden centres. There are 14 staff but three are part-time. The busiest days are Saturday and Sunday. They sell garden furniture and equipment as well as plants that are bought mainly from Holland, Belgium and Denmark. Every year Mr. Ward's staff take cuttings from the heathers and put them in trays. The trays hold about 200 heathers. They are then put in long arch-shaped greenhouses to grow ready for selling. Mr. Ward told us that more of his customers come to the garden centre when the sun shines.
